meanings.definition: A distinctive uniform worn by a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The hotel staff wore bright red liveries to stand out.
meanings.sent2: The football team proudly displayed their blue and white liveries.
meanings.sent3: The penguin comedy duo decided to wear matching liveries for their show.
meanings.sent4: The forest seemed to wear a livery of green and brown in the autumn.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's livery was a shining silver suit with a bold emblem.

meanings.definition: The identifying colors or design worn by a sports team.
meanings.sent1: The basketball team's orange and black liveries were eye-catching.
meanings.sent2: Fans proudly wore the team's liveries to show their support.
meanings.sent3: The little league team's livery clashed with the referee's uniform.
meanings.sent4: The stadium was a sea of different liveries from various teams.
meanings.sent5: The championship game featured two teams with striking liveries.

meanings.definition: The feeding of horses or other animals.
meanings.sent1: The stable hand took care of the horses' daily liveries.
meanings.sent2: Proper liveries are essential for the health of the livestock.
meanings.sent3: The farm cat eagerly awaited the morning livery of fresh milk.
meanings.sent4: The zookeeper ensured the animals received their varied liveries on time.
meanings.sent5: The pet owner carefully prepared the cat's livery of fish and kibble.
